Definition: This task requires you to provide the sentiment of a given sentence in English. The sentiment can be either positive (happy) or negative (offmychest).

Positive Examples.input: was down for a long time , wanted to show off what changed all that , my mermaid hair .
Positive Examples.explanation: This is considered positive sentiment since the speaker disjuncts "was down for a long time" with their new changed hair insinuating a positive sentiment; therefore, it is correctly classified.

Positive Examples.input: i hate working . i know most people feel the same way . i just absolutely hate working 40 hours a week . i feel like i ’m wasting my life away at work . i hate it . i ’d rather do so many other things . after i graduated undergrad , i went back to school after a year because i hated working full time . after graduating with my masters , i still hate working .
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, it would be classified as negative sentiment because the context speaker uses strong negative connotative words such as "hate", "wasting", "rather", etc; so, it is classified correctly

Negative Examples.input: i have spent more than half my life biting my nails as an anxiety coping mechanism . today it 's exactly 3 months since i 'd stopped . it makes me so happy and proud and i have no one else to share it with .
Negative Examples.explanation: In this context, it is not correctly classified as the speaker mentions extreme feelings of happiness after stopping a negative habit and use of the word "proud"

Negative Examples.input: i hate . i hate that i feel in love with the person i consider my best friend . i hate the fact that i know the only way i can stop having stop these feelings is to completely remove her from my life . i hate the fact that its going that its going to hurt us . i hate that i 've to come to this decision
Negative Examples.explanation: This example is incorrectly classified as positive; whereas, it should be classified as positive because the speaker uses strong negatively-connotated words such as "hate", "stop", "remove", and "hurt".

Instances.input: you assholes ruined my favourite uncle 's funeral .
today my fiancé got engaged to a stranger .

i have a job interview today ! i 'm preparing to defend my thesis for a master 's degree in chemistry . today i 'm interviewing for a job to begin after the defense , and on top of it all , i 'm only two months away from getting married . i 'm nervous but very excited at the same time .
sick of people that act like my best friend in person then ignore me on social media . what 's up with that bullshit ?

i got the job ! well , internship . but much like getting into good colleges , it 's hard as fuck to find internships these days as a college freshman . too much competition , from more decorated students . but somehow i managed to get one , and as a bonus , it 's paid pretty well . man , i 'm fucking pumped . now it 's just a matter of my lazy ass making the most of it .
my mother has had severe hearing loss for the majority of her life . last weekend marked the first weekend that she has been able to truly hear since she was a little girl .
police officer cites and releases man for stealing school supplies for his kids then uses his own money to buy food for the guy 's family . via reddit.com .
